reviews.review_msg: She's cool, I think she deserves a 'peppa' forsure
The final was intense, but if you attend all the classes, Tomasz lectures are very good. Cute and a great instructor!
I liked him!  He was very well informed and kept things interesting.  I would take another class with him.

Paul has been one of the best profs Ive had. Makes class concepts super clear and easy to understand. The TA was the worst Ive ever had in 4 years at SFU. Made tutorials pointless and graded super hard. When asked why you got a certain grade, he had no reason or explaination for how or why he graded how he did.

Dr. K is knowledgeable in consumption studies. He makes difficult concepts easy to grasp by using modern relevant examples to highlight the theories. You won't do well if you miss his lectures-which you don't want to miss anyhow because they are highly entertaining. Go see him for more ideas when writing your paper-he can provide more angles.

Truly, Paul is brilliant. Inside and out.  He is very kind, approachable, caring and the most passionate soul I have ever met. He is an excellent lecturer and very fair. Great sense of humour! Very engaging!  He is incredibly interesting and inspiring. The dept is very lucky to have someone like him. Also, the dept is amazing too! You will love it!

Paul is a terrific professor but a very difficult marker. Like many of the posts already made, you will not do well if you skip lectures.  Because of his strong research background, many of the concepts he covers are quite obscure. As such, you will be unable to wiki/google the answers. I recommend attending his office hours.

Paul is my fav prof at SFU. Emphasizes that hes there to help you along with your paper or if you have any questions. No textbook but light readings from journals he uploads. Tutorial participation is essential. Midterm and final are fair. Class material is super interesting and you can tell that Paul is also passionate in what he teaches.

Paul is super friendly and interesting. GEOG 325 is not a very practical course, its kinda like cultural geography. Interesting, but very social sciencey. I worked for my A- but nothing too strenuous. Paul is very fair and going to see him in his office hours is actually fun...
